website_summaries.verdict: Once you upgrade these with a better insole, these boots are a great lightweight option that will keep your feet very dry.
pros: Fit well, particularly for wide feet
Come in a choice of dark brown, olive, or coffee
cons: Soles of the boots are pretty hard, and the insoles that come with them are thin

customer_reviews.title: The boot lacks cushion and some sort of extra cushion is highly recommended, especially for anybody that has a history of ...
customer_reviews.text: I walk anywhere from 5 to 9 miles a day, 5 days a week. The picture shows 7 months of wear and tear. The upper lasts far longer than the soles. This was my second pair and both wore out the same way, the sole. The boot lacks cushion and some sort of extra cushion is highly recommended, especially for anybody that has a history of Plantar Fasciitis. If Danner fixed their sole issue they would offer a great boot.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Convert
customer_reviews.text: Fifth pair in 3 years of large scale commercial construction (solely because I'm a fan of new and clean boots). Hah, a pun... My first 13 years of Construction & Construction Management were Timberline, Georgia, Carolinas, and then finally Red Wings; finally found my match! Roomy and comfy for the miles I walk and I get comments when meeting with the clients and design teams. I have converted many to the Danners brand. Next step is converting the Safety Department to Danners over the last brand I named with our Safety Incentive programs!
customer_reviews.author: MizzSteelo

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these boots, but they are really heavy and have just a bit too much extra room in them. If you're standing in place, and have thicker feet or wear huge socks they may work well for you, and the construction and stitching is good. The weight is heavier than any other boot I own in the size and price range, and it wears my feet out over a longer day. I'll pull them out for going out for a couple of hours since they look fairly nice, but I wouldn't recommend these to walk around all day in. More of a 3.5 star boot, but for the price I expect a less weight.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: quality boots, wish they were taller.
customer_reviews.text: out of the box I thought the leather looked more scuffed than they should, but it's fine, not trying to have clean hiking boots for show. I have been wearing 8-10in tall logging boots, so the 5 1/2 was a change. The area that needs broken in is right where my foot bends when i walk. Tread felt rugged enough, would not climb smooth wet rocks though, cause you will slip. Might change the insole out just cause I prefer a hockey heel. A lot of top of the foot space inside, good side fit. Overall, they are okay, I would buy them again if they came in a 6-8 shaft height. cat tax
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the 453.
customer_reviews.text: If you're used to the Danner 453, don't get the 452 thinking they may be very similar. They are not. The 452 is taller, less comfortable and sized differently. The pair I recieved felt like the boots were two different sizes, though the tags were the same. I've never had that problem before. Returned for refund. Will be going back to the 453 which I've had 2 pairs in the last 3 year's. They last me, when others don't.
customer_reviews.author: airtight_python

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced, poor durability
customer_reviews.text: Very long break in period, tread wears down too fast, black toe cap ripped....now, with that in mind, I am a UPS driver for a living...im in and out of my delivery vehicle 250+ times per day....the floor in these trucks are abrasive diamond plate steel...I am very rough on boots and usually go through 3-4 pair per year. These boots were destroyed after about 2.5 months of daily wear. WAY TO FAST FOR A PAIR OF BOOTS THAT COST NEARLY $200!! I would not buy again. Have had better durabily and comfort out of Keen and Merrel boots.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Longwell

customer_reviews.title: Let me begin by acknowledging that I don't like boots. But these Danners are an exception
customer_reviews.text: Let me begin by acknowledging that I don't like boots. But these Danners are an exception. I've been wearing them in San Miguel de Allende Mexico since early May. The streets everywhere are cobblestone, the sidewalks have unexpected rises and falls, and there are open holes hear and there. I need secure footing, and these do the job. Also, I walk our dog 45 - 60 minutes in the morning and again in the evening, and we follow rough muddy trails on a nearby hillside. Same thing: secure footing. Plus they are dry and light, and clean up with minimal effort - I mix Dawn in water in a tub and lightly scrub. I just might buy another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Raybador

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THEM!!!!! I bought these boots for me due to not being able to find a good, sturdy "woman's" work boot around. They were a little stiff in the ankle area which is to be expected so it took a couple days to make them more flexible. I'm on my feet for 10-12 hrs a day walking on concrete and now my feet don't hate me anymore due to these boots!! I plan to buy another pair or 2 of them to keep for a back ups. :)
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: ... Danner work boots that are a 9D and fit perfect. These seem a bit bigger
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for work in an Amazon warehouse and I chose this size becuase I have another pair of Danner work boots that are a 9D and fit perfect. These seem a bit bigger, so I wear thick mountain climbing socks with another regular low-cut pair inside and they are more snug for me. I probably shoud have gotten the 8 1/2. Overall I really like them exept the top is really stiff and rubs the back of my leg but it will probably go away as it gets broken in. Solid shoe for sure!
customer_reviews.author: lowell

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a pair of these and they lasted over four years of continuous usage from general walking to working to hiking. They are extremely comfortable, and even when the last pair started to break down, they remained impressively waterproof. Definitely recommend these for work, casual wear, or hiking, as they can do all three extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: RedFalcon696

customer_reviews.title: I finally decided to purchase the 452 and was shocked at just how comfortable they are
customer_reviews.text: Since this was going to be my first pair of serious hiking boots, I reserached quite a few types of boots. I finally decided to purchase the 452 and was shocked at just how comfortable they are. I wore them for hours the first day and had no issues, they were very comfortable. They are heavy duty boots and have some heft to them but my guess is that you could walk through anything with these babies and they would be no worse for wear. I highly reccommned them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built to last!!
customer_reviews.text: According to my husband, when the apocalypse comes there will be three things left: Twinkies, roaches, and Danner boots! These things are built to last! They feel great and are surprisingly light for how stout they are. The toe cap is very durable and they are roomy inside. I wear them with Darn Tough boot socks (which are also awesome). These would be great for hiking, hunting, etc.. The back of the ankle rubbed the first couple days and was a little uncomfortable, but after a bit they loosened up. Great product! I ordered Danners because that is what I wore in the military. I wear a 9.5 athletic shoe (Saucony and Addidas) and I ordered 9.5 Danner boots.
customer_reviews.author: mommyof4

customer_reviews.title: Made to be worn
customer_reviews.text: The boot is tight when first start to wear. It does widen up upon breaking in. Boots look exactly like photos. Feet hurt a tad until I broke them in. Break-in took about 4 days of all day wear. Love these boots. Just hope for the money that the soles are replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Underimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this boot was stiff, bulky, and difficult to lace. In a market where quality hiking boots come out-of-the-box trail ready, there isnt really a reason to force your feet to endure a break-in period with stiff uncomfortable boots. True to Danner boots, you'll need to shell out some extra $$ if you want comfortable insoles. Keep looking, I don't think you'll be disappointed you passed up these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Past experience with Danner, though limited, fit has ...
customer_reviews.text: Past experience with Danner, though limited, fit has been close to slightly large. I intended to wear these with thicker socks so ordered my regular size which turned out to be too short and too narrow. Returned them and ordered wider width and half size larger and the fit is just what I wanted. The return process was fairly painless. I've worn these daily for a few weeks now and the stiffness hasn't been an issue with comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Al G

customer_reviews.title: Danner. It's "wear" the feet go to heaven.
customer_reviews.text: I owned a pair of Danner Mountain boots since 2009. I served in the Corps for 14 years, 1981 to 1995. Four overseas deployments, three in war zones. I wish I had been wearing a pair of Danner boots. Don't be stupid. Go Danner. Nuff said. Semper Fi.
customer_reviews.author: shawn rice

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 10-12th pair. They are really comfortable right out of the box. Have never given me discomfort after several miles of hunting hells canyon day after day. I also use them for work and motorcycle riding. Best boot I’ve ever used and I’ve been in the construction world for almost 30 years
customer_reviews.author: roynunez

customer_reviews.title: The Best boot I have ever Had.
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best hiking/hunting boot i have ever had. I have 2 pair at any given time. I start the fall season with 1 pair from the previous year and then one new pair. The new pair replaces the old pair from the previous year. I alternate the 2 pair I have with each other daily to allow the other pair to rest and remove any moisture to dissipate before the next days use.......unless on an extended hike away from base camp. They are light weight, water proof, and wear incredibly well In my opinion you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: John A Ostrowski

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Danner boots. All three pair were comfortable right out of the box although somewhat stiff as expected. I could fill the page with praise for Danner boots but you should buy a pair of you own and see and feel the excellent quality. I picked the dark brown color for these boots and I was not disappointed. I have tried numerous other brands and I have always been disappointed in some way. These do not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Preacher23

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Hold up great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great work boots! My husband works a very hard labor job and walks around 10 miles a day so we go through work boots like crazy! These are the only boots he can get a year out of. This is our 4th pair of these and will continue to buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Shanee

customer_reviews.title: Well designed boot
customer_reviews.text: Great fit out of the box. A little stiff but that should lessen with wear. I estimate they will take a couple weeks to really break in, just like my last similar pair. There is good cushion and impact resistance when walking over gravel and rocks. Good boot. I’m sticking with Danner.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan Chick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box. I have been wearing these boots for the last two weeks and the only complaint I have is around the top of the boot kind of rubs, but I was wearing cotton athletic socks at the time, and when I put on some wool socks, the problem went away. I have wide feet and was worried about buying shoes I haven't tried on yet, but these boots are great. I wear a 9 1/2, and ordered the 9 1/2 2E and they fit great. I have some timberland 4E steel toe and the Danner 2E feel just about as wide. I highly recommend Danner boots.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I will no longer purchase these boots
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, however the 'vibram' soles were very disappointing. They provide no traction on wet surfaces. I do construction and have bought this same boot for many years. The soles are no longer of the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: aj bondi

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boot! At first, it was a bit like wearing a ski boot but by the end of the day, I didn't know that I even had them on. The first boot that I have had which needed such a short break-in period. Since then I have worn them through all different kinds of adventures and I'm still smiling.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S. White

customer_reviews.title: Total Rip-off
customer_reviews.text: Boots are bulky heavy and they run small, also seller rips you off on returns by charging for re-stocking fee and return shipping charges
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OVERALL ON 1ST IMPRESSION, A GOOD SOLID, WELL CONSTRUCTED BOOT.
customer_reviews.text: AS I HAVE ONLY HAD THEM ONE WEEK, AND WORN THEM FOR 4 DAYS AT WORK. IT SEEMS TO BE TOO EARLY TO WRITE AN HONEST REVIEW. THEY STILL NEED BREAKING IN. FIRST IMPRESSION, LOVE THE WELT/SEWEN SOLE CONSTRUTION. CORDURA MATERIAL SEEM TO BE STRONGER THAN 1000. PANELS ARE DOUBLE STITCHED, (RATHER SEE TRIPLE STITCH ON A WORK BOOT). GORETEX LINED (ABSOLUTELY THE BEST) SOLE DESIGN IS A LET DOWN, COMPARED TO OTHER DANNER SOLES. THESE SOLES, I BELIEVE WILL WEAROUT WITHIN 6 TO 8 MONTHS. TIME WILL TELL. OVERALL ON 1ST IMPRESSION, A GOOD SOLID, WELL CONSTRUCTED BOOT.
customer_reviews.author: fishman487

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! They were pretty comfortable right out of the box. I ordered the same size/width I always do and they fit great. I only have 3 days on them now, but they have broken in a bit and are even more comfortable. I don't think I'll ever go back to wearing traditional work boot type boots again after these. The only complaint I can come up with are the insoles, they are horrible. Just cheap, extremely thin foam, almost like they expect you to replace them. A $10 pair of dr schols gel made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: SFinn

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought another pair, after buying my first pair 5 months ago. I need a 2nd pair to keep at my cabin. These feel a little heavier than my older Danner boots, but they're slightly roomier than older ones of the same size too. These are comfortable out of the box, no breaking in for me. Great tread, flexible upper. Not entirely waterproof, but seem to be water-resistant - My feet don't get wet after hiking through tall wet grass or shallow water. I plan to take these to Iceland for a hunt next year.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Dover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and worn Danner Boots for over 30 years. I have Never been disappointed. The quality and craftsmanship is unsurpassed. Yes, these boots will require a little break in period but that's because they're BOOTS and Not the typical Hiking boots that are flooding the market, which for lack of a better description, are little more than a "pip squeek tennis shoe" with Big Knobby Tires". I find great comfort by the thought of still being able to wear these boots 5 years from now.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Henry

customer_reviews.title: These have to be the best lightweight hiker workboots.
customer_reviews.text: I weigh over 400 lbs. and work as a Union Glazier. These boots take a pounding, provide excellent cushoining and protection. Danner makes an excellent poduct.
customer_reviews.author: NorCalBigE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot that's well made with GREAT Style!
customer_reviews.text: Love the boots! Ordered wide, could be just a bit wider in the toe area. To be fair, I'm still rating fit as expected since it's only one foot that seems just a bit tighter in the toe, most of us have one foot that's slightly larger than the other and 11.5 is just too big. A local merchant only had standard width which I tried on, the extra wide width seems negligible in the toe and fine everywhere else. All-in-all they're still comfortable and a very nice boot at a great price on Amazon compared to what I found locally.
customer_reviews.author: razza

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work boots and I am on my feet most of the day. They hold up better than their competitors and are in line with price. Does what it is supposed to do and what more can you ask.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis D. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Comfort Has Deteriorated Update
customer_reviews.text: Comfort has deteriorated significantly. Can’t wear these without my ankles bleeding from the harsh rubbing in that area. UPDATE: I found a new way to lace a boot on YouTube. These boots are now more comfortable around ankle area.
customer_reviews.author: Trebor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome traction and feel like there already broken in
customer_reviews.text: Awesome traction and feel like there already broken in..these are great for trails that are steep..only complaint is that i wish they were made in America...
customer_reviews.author: silver god

customer_reviews.title: love my Danners
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking Boots. fully gusseted tounge which helps keeps dirt out of your boots. Sturdy soles and Lightweight. They are not resoleable but personally after I've had them on my feet long enough to wear them out hiking they are ready for yardwork.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great choice.
customer_reviews.text: So I just got these and only have a few miles in them, here's my initial impression. 1: out of the box they are very stiff and require some break in. 2: the fit is excellent. I wear a 13ee and these fit very well. The 13 is true to size, the width is good without being too loose. 3: my first short hike was great. The overall feel was firm and supportive. I am very happy with these hikers. Heading to the mountains in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: jmas

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I retired from the US Army infantry and have "field tested" a lot of boots. Danner's always come out on top. I have a pair of the Radical 452s that I have put through the ringer on Washington state trails and they are still in great shape. I am looking to pick up another pair now to make the ones that I have spares. I am a size 12 and these were true to size. The only fault that I have seen is that the tread has worn down quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Boots EVER !
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these boots about 5 years ago and they are still in great shape.. AMAZING boots.. I highly recommend these hiking/work boots. Completely comfortable and well made ! All Danner boots are pretty expensive but as the old saying goes "Buy once, cry once".
customer_reviews.author: TD Tourney

customer_reviews.title: Stick with what works
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Danners for the last 3 pairs of shoes I've bought for everyday wear... Then I thought I'd try something else... All that did was waste my time, and teach me how to do an Amazon return! The only thing I'd change on these is that they need a bigger pull strap loop on the back of the shoe. Different models have bigger loops, this one just is a model with too small of a loop. Comfortable from the moment they came out of the box!!
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Weak outsole
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for use in the BWCA back in March, our trip was in June and now it's September and the outsole is nearly worn slick. I don't wear these that often either. Perhaps only 1x or 2x a week. Very disappointed. However, brand new out of the box, these were great. 100% water proof, when there WAS tread they gripped the earth well, and were supportive.
customer_reviews.author: ANTLE5

customer_reviews.title: On top of that they are very comfortable! They are a bit heavy though compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots ROCK! They are fashionable enough if you wear hiking boots all the time (like I do) for someone to notice. On top of that they are very comfortable! They are a bit heavy though compared to other boots. I hope they will last me for a long-time! Best part is, there is nothing you need to do.. Just put them on and tighten up the laces well... Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: If you want sure footed boots with great ankle support AND comfort....take a look at these.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about these boots. At first they felt a bit tight, a bit stiff but by the end of the week I didn't want to take them off. The 12W fit like an old friend and I have Flintstone feet that seldom find comfort this good in any shoe much less a boot. Very good ankle support, water repelancy appears good too. No ankle deep water test though, just rain. Nice boots!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: I know they are new and need to be broken in but in the mean time I walk around like Frankenstein as they are a bit stiff
customer_reviews.text: I gave them a 4 because I have chaffing on my left foot on the achilles tendon which requires me to cover the area.. I know they are new and need to be broken in but in the mean time I walk around like Frankenstein as they are a bit stiff. They are a nice looking boot and I'm sure once they are broken in they will be great.
customer_reviews.author: JMH

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I wore them hiking in Alaska and hunting in Arizona. Amazing support and comfort. I liked them so much I bought a second pair 2 years later. You would be dumb not to buy them
customer_reviews.author: Thomas richards

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable lightweight Gortex boots
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Danner 452 Radical boots. They are my favorite Gortex well ventilated boots. Lightweight and the soles don't pick up lots of soil and grass that tracks into vehicles and houses. Durable but the soles will be the first thing to go. I love the support you get from a Danner boot. I also wear insulated elk boots from Danner.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Oran

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be a good value and comforatable
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Super comfortable. I would describe the fit to be perfect, but only I have my feet, so you have to figure that our on your own. They are good enough looking for the trails. There are WAY cooler Danners, but these were a good value and I wont mind thrashing them. Some questions to durability in the reviews but the boots will probably last me a long time. I will only wear them for weekend hikes.
customer_reviews.author: M. BRACCO

customer_reviews.title: no break in required!
customer_reviews.text: this is my first pair of 452 danners. the only issue I had was I inserted gel insoles thinking the boots would be more comfortable, the insoles created a foot lift which made the rim of the boot lower on my ankles which rubbed an enormous blister! I removed the insoles and the boots touched my ankles where they should with no pain or problem. they're comfortable enough out of the box so I suggest leave the insoles at the store! I would recommend these boots to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: mike mcfalls

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect, but after a couple of hours in them and they start to dig into your skin around the top of the boot. They are very hard. Not comfortable at all. The sole in these boots are unforgiving. They are very stiff and hard. I would purchase these again and would not recommend them. P.S. I've had Danner boots in the past and never had this problem. Maybe their high end boots are more friendlier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Boots Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit right out of the box but got even more comfortable after a couple of days. I like these boots because of the generous room in the toe box area. I wear these boots everyday For all kinds of activities ( hiking, working, gardening, motorcycling, fishing, camping, etc) and they are super comfortable. Much better than Merrill because they are wide and don't pinch my feet as much. If you want the best, most comfortable hiking but buy these - you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: 04rk88

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boot
customer_reviews.text: Great work boot. I have been wearing these boots for years. I own a property maintenance company and wear these boots every day. Great fit right out of the box no break in peroid. They keep my feet dry and give me great support. I can usually get a year out off them. This is probably my 5th or 6th pair over the last 5 years. I work on all types of surfaces like concrete,wood,grass,dirt etc they really hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Casella

customer_reviews.title: Look and feel good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! It's only been a few days of use but so far I love these boots! As Ive gotten older I need wide sizes so I ordered these in 11 wide and they fit great! There's enough room for me to use heavy wool socks this winter if needed and they fit fine with a wood blend so far. The quality looks good and I'm looking forward to the slushy snow now!
customer_reviews.author: johhnystorm1

customer_reviews.title: These are better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide (EEE) foot and most of the time I cannot find a shoe in EEE. So I make due with a wide or EE. I had decided going into this boot that it would feel a little tight until they broke in some which is the case with most shoes / boots for me. I was very surprised to find that they are very comfortable right out of the box. I'm glad I bought two pair. I really like the neutral color that goes with most everything I wear. These are a great all around boot for our Montana weather.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Husband's favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My husband's favorite boots. These are his 4th or 5th pair of them. His only complaint is that he wishes the soles would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Incredible boot!
customer_reviews.text: Every thing about these boots is top quality, both in materials and workmanship. In addition they are comfortable out of the box. This is my 3 rd pair of Danners and have the same opinion of every pair...BUT. I tried to save money and purchased another Timberland PRO Mudslinger. Absolute junk. Right out of the box you can tell. Tried them on, walked around the living room, put them back in the box and shipped them back. Do yourself a favor and spend a few extra bucks and get the Danners...
customer_reviews.author: schmidt911

customer_reviews.title: Among the best boots I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for construction/service work. I have a wide foot, so it can be very difficult to shop for boots at most stores. I got the boots to wear in the summer, as the rocky boots I have for winter have thinsulate and cook your feet in weather over 60 degrees. They breathe better than any boots I have ever had. They have excellent traction and are very stable. I have had them for 4 months or so and they have no damage at all so far. They are worn in all weather and conditions for spring/summer in southern Ohio. Cannot recommend these strongly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: It is not easy buying shoes online without being able to try them on but as always with every other Danner boot we have purchased they were spot on. We bought them for my husband to wear for work and he loves them. They are lighter than his winter boots which is exactly what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Chapek

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for work use. These are his favorite boots for work because they are comfortable, long lasting, look great, and provide support for his high arch.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Tenan

customer_reviews.title: Premier Work Boot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been a Danner fan! My last pair lasted almost a decade of abuse! This new pair doesn’t let down! Expensive but worth the price! Comfortable true work boot great on the farm! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MedicCapt

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: These boots absolutely amazed me most comfortable boots I've ever owned. They have great support fairly light and just by far the best all around boot ive ever owned. Cant comment on how long they last because ive only had them for a few months but even if they only last one season the comfort alone is worth buying again.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Good brand, just not the right shoe
customer_reviews.text: Yea it's wide, but it didn't fit well enough to keep.
customer_reviews.author: Halee

customer_reviews.title: good work boot
customer_reviews.text: this is the second pair of Danner boots my husband has had. The first pair lasted 2 years of work everyday.
customer_reviews.author: susan rifenburgh

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe period.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Danners. This is the second pair of these I have owned. The first pair I bought 5 years ago before our trip to the Grand Canyon. I have worn this pair almost everyday. I have done numerous hunting (upland game) trips and fishing trips etc. I wore the soles completely off of the first pair and it is the only reason I am buying a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Walleyewarrior

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and holding up great
customer_reviews.text: They took about 30 miles to break in but I've worn these over 700 miles and are very supportive, comfortable and holding up great! I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kramer

customer_reviews.title: They aren't the best on wet rocks
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for 50 miles of rough hiking in the Smokies. It rained 4 out of 6 days. On day 4 my boots started to leak, but everyones did as well. My boots were the last to leak. After 4 days of down pours, any Gortex boot will start to leak. However, these boots are vey tough and withstood all types of terrain. They aren't the best on wet rocks, but aren't the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Bunky6765

customer_reviews.title: Great looking boot, just too narrow for me.
customer_reviews.text: These looked awesome and seemed made really well. Unfortunately, even the EE was too narrow for me, and seemed more like a D to me. Ended up returning them for something wider. Went with a timberland that was also goretex in EE, and they were more true to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Andy_Tay's_Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking shoe but needs some break in
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these hiking they seem very durable and comfortable. They are a little stiff and heavy so they need a little break in time
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Easily one of the most well built hiking boots I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of the most well built hiking boots I've owned. Comfortable, supportive, fits great, looks good. A bit stiff when new, but become a bit more flexible within the first 6 miles or so.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Look good, fit great , work even better
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these boots at work for a little over 2 months now, and with out a doubt these boots are the best every day, non steel toe work boot I have ever worn, they fit great out of the box, have excellent traction and support and are built really well to top it off.
customer_reviews.author: KIM A CHRISTENSEN

customer_reviews.title: Stick to the USA Danner
customer_reviews.text: Sole wore out after 6 months and nothing you can do to fix them as are not rebuildable alot of money for a boot that is in perfect shape except for there is no tread on the bottom
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: No ankle support  ! Unfortunately  !
customer_reviews.text: I so wanted these to work out , ive been wearing Georgias for about 19 yrs, the quality is not like it use to , thought i test the waters and see whats out there with of course the Goretex liner , these boots have no ankle support , unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Checo

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this company's shoes. He says they are good quality. I bought them for him. He likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Hiro

customer_reviews.title: Recommend highly, both item and seller.
customer_reviews.text: Weather delays caused a shipping problem, but that's not the fault of the seller. A great boot for everyday, outdoor wear, fit was exactly as expected, the price was at least $40.00 below other offers, so a great bargain. I recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Howard A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best every day shoe
customer_reviews.text: Super high quality. After 2 months of wearing them every day they are my favorie shoe. Exceptionally durable and surprisingly breathable for a shoe this waterproof. 23 years in the army left me with wrecked spine and painful feet. I wear custom orthopedic inserts that are well accommodated in this shoe. Very comfortable out of the box too!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie M. Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built
customer_reviews.text: For me, the toe area has a bit more room than I'd like but still fit well. The top of the shoe around the ankle area rubs a bit but I believe they will break in nicely. I bought these along with a pair of Lowa boots. Comparing the two, the Lowa's win hands down in comfort, fit, and style. However, I'll be switching between the two on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: John Maurais

customer_reviews.title: Bad pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: I return them the right boot made a clicking sound when you walked
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Danner Fan
customer_reviews.text: I love Danner boots. This is at least my fourth pair of Radicals. I haven't bought a new pair in the last few years, and ordered the same size as I've always worn in these. This pair seems just slightly big for me, but would probably be tight in a half size smaller. All previous pairs have been an exact fit for me. This is the only reason I gave four stars, otherwise I believe these to be a five star boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: I really like the color and stile but the tongue is kinda ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the color and stile but the tongue is kinda short so it will dig into your shin a bit, the Danner Radical 453's tongue is slightly longer and has a leather patch in the top inside tongue so that takes care of that problem. The 453 has a better insole also. The list price for the 453 is only about $10 bucks more but seems like you can find it for about the same price or less depending on color as the 452
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Arch issue for me
customer_reviews.text: I wore an old pair of this model boot for 15 years. I believe they used to be made in the States. I've got a problem with the arch in this new pair. The strong arch-support is too narrow on one foot. I changed the insole to make it bearable--and developed a callus there. I've never worn wide shoes, so . . . I'll probably look at other brands when I have the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and as expected. On my 3rd pair. They last about 8 months to a year as work boots standing on 275° F asphalt.
customer_reviews.author: Garek P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very Comfortable and feels really solid. Great Boot.I thought I would do a followup on these boots as of 6-20-2016. I have worn these on quite a few hikes now and the break-in was very easy. These 452 GTX boots are everything I could ask for and look like they will be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great boot but needs to be in all camo patterns .
customer_reviews.text: I use this boot for every thing love them , should always have this boot in all camo patterns .
customer_reviews.author: HARVEY BROWN

customer_reviews.title: He loves the outdoors and needed good footwear. He loves these boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hiking boots for my husband. He loves the outdoors and needed good footwear. He loves these boots. They are true to size, are quality made and durable. He will wear them for quite some time. A very good buy for a quality product. A+
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Feel like air
customer_reviews.text: I got these in the mail around 6pm after being on my feet all day. My dogs were tired, I slipped these on just for giggles and was GREATLY surprised at the comfort I really felt like I was walking on air. I am a week later still impressed with the way they feel.
customer_reviews.author: gergsggib

customer_reviews.title: Good Job Again Danner!
customer_reviews.text: Danner has always put out the best boot for me as prior military with foot and knee injuries, but this particular boot is AMAZING! It looks good! Feels good! Day 1, I wore it hiking up the beach. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sarge and the Rowdy Friends Band.

customer_reviews.title: look good, fit good
customer_reviews.text: look good, fit good, seem very well put together. I will be wearing them as one pair of a few for my daily walking. I always rotate my boots, and shoes. I have sensitive feet, and will change shoes several times a day. so far these are doing great! worth every penny! thanks, Jimi-sue.
customer_reviews.author: jimi-sue

customer_reviews.title: I love the look.
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking and quality made. I've had them for several months and still haven't broken them in yet so I cannot wear them for more than a few hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Stock

customer_reviews.title: Love my Danner's
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th set of Danner Radicals! I also wear three other pair of Danner boots for work. The Radicals are my every day do everything boot. They commonly last me 2.5 years before I wear them out. Love my Danner's!
customer_reviews.author: jkl images

customer_reviews.title: Danner Boot Pre-Worn
customer_reviews.text: This boot is O.K. except someone else broke it in. I think it was used by someone before I got the boot!!! The boot was stretch out.
customer_reviews.author: Hermies Hermits

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: My feet are a little wide through the mid-section and these shoes fit great. The day they arrived I went out and planted a hundred saplings in the rain and my feet were comfortable and dry when I got done. Great ankle support, strong sole, water proof, and durable. The leather was actually so firm, it took a few days to where the laces lay flat on the tongue. They are a little big for my size, but that is good to add room for wearing insulated socks.
customer_reviews.author: JeffR

customer_reviews.title: good quality boots
customer_reviews.text: I put many miles on these boots and they have been the longest lasting that I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice boot but i literally wore out the sole in 3 months. would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: chris kloster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for wide foot
customer_reviews.text: Ordered EE width and they were perfect for my husbands wide foot. No break in time, no blisters. Walks in them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. Stiff at the top; Cuts into my ankle a bit. I'm expecting it to go away as they get worn in.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Morales

customer_reviews.title: Light and well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I really haven't had the chance to lace these up and put a few good mountain miles on them. However, the initial fit seems very good. They are really light for their size and the semi aggressive sole should prove well. Anxious to try them on wet, muddy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Doug S. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Great For Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: Though this is my second pair, I didn't know these babies came in 2E width until discovering them on Amazon. And my 4E feet never felt more comfortable in hiking boots! My first pair, a very generous medium width size, purchased a couple years ago at a local sporting goods store, worked fine because I wore thinner socks. Because I can now wear thicker, more cushiony socks, there's no problem wearing these boots all day. Folks with really wide feet will find these boots a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Pokeymon

customer_reviews.title: Danner Quality is the Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of Danner Lights some years ago as a field boot and was impressed with the sturdy construction and fit. Now, years later, I'm happy to report nothing has changed. I did alot of looking and comparison shopping for a hiking boot and ended up back with a known quantity--Danner. These boots fit perfectly right out of the box, and I am a true 11 and a half D in virtually every shoe I've ever worn. You will not go wrong with the 452, and you absolutely get what you pay for. I'm sold and you will be too.
customer_reviews.author: epicurean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Medium Duty Boot
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, needed very little break in. Just as I would expect with Danner Boot products, they are my favorite brand for medium to heavy hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: JMJ

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Radical 452 GTX as a replacement for the Danner Zigzag Trail which is no longer madesign. I actually like these boots better! Durable, stable platform, scuff proof toe cap. Leather upper and of course, Gore Tex. Real toughness in a lighter weight boot!
customer_reviews.author: lostdutchman

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, needs better sole life
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, this was my 3rd pair in about 8 years. The leather uppers hold up, but the soles seem to wear out faster than I'd want and are not replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: M Smetana

customer_reviews.title: fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: This is my husband's 3rd pair of this style Danner boot. No break-in needed, fit like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: Danner Men's Radical 452 5.5" Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: At Danner, they are craftsmen. They pay attention to details. They forgo quantity for quality, with the knowledge that the boots they craft are no better than the hands that create them.
feature_bullets: Durable, nubuck leather upper with rugged 1000 denier nylon
TERRA FORCE platform offers lightweight performance and stability
Danner Boulder TF outsole with multi-directional lugs offers stability on rugged terrain
